explanations.A: This is the number of tonnes in 1 gram! We need the number of grams in 1 tonne.
explanations.B: Not quite. This is the number of kilograms in 1 tonne or the number of grams in 1 kilogram. We need the number of grams in 1 tonne.
explanations.C: We need to multiply by two lots of 1000 rather than adding two lots of 1000.
explanations.D: 1 tonne is 1000 kg, and 1kg is 1000 grams. So, 1 tonne = 1000 × 1000 = 1,000,000 grams.

explanations.A: 1 kilogram is 2.2 pounds, which is 2.2 × 16 = 35.2 ounces. So 1 ounce is roughly 1/35 th of a kilogram.
explanations.B: I think you have added 16 and 2.2 together to get a number close to 18. Instead, use multiplication to first work out how many ounces are in 1 kg.
explanations.C: I think you have divided 16 by 2.2 to get a number close to 7. Instead, use multiplication to first work out how many ounces are in 1 kg.
explanations.D: This is the fraction of 1 kilogram that is 1 pound. We need the fraction that is 1 ounce.

explanations.A: This is the number of feet in half a mile. We need the number of inches.
explanations.B: We have 1 mile = 1760 yards = 1760 × 3 = 5280 feet, then 5280 feet = 5280 × 12 = 63,360. Dividing this by 2 to find half a mile gives us 31 680 inches for half a mile.
explanations.C: You have forgotten to convert to feet before converting to inches.
explanations.D: This is the number of inches in 1 mile. We need the number of inches in half a mile.
